title: Warrior (role)
data:
The **Warrior** is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") that appears in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). They are a pure fighting-class derived from the [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight") that starts with similar proficiency in [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding"), though they lack the Knight's [jumping](/wiki/Jumping "Jumping") ability and less emphasis on offensive spellcasting and mounted combat - the [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance") and [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") skills outside of [divination spells](/wiki/Divination_spell "Divination spell") are restricted for Warriors.

Warriors must be lawful or neutral, and can be played as [clockwork automata](/wiki/Clockwork_automata "Clockwork automata"), [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)"), [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), [giants](/wiki/Giant_\(starting_race\) "Giant (starting race)"), [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)"), [hobbits](/wiki/Hobbit_\(starting_race\) "Hobbit (starting race)"), [humans](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), or [kobolds](/wiki/Kobold_\(starting_race\) "Kobold (starting race)").

The Warrior's starting pet is a [saddled](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle") [pony](/wiki/Pony "Pony"). Just like the Knight, a Warrior's riding skill starts out Basic, allowing the player to pick up items while riding.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Starting equipment](#Starting_equipment)
- [2 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [3 Techniques](#Techniques)
- [4 Skills](#Skills)
- [5 Gods](#Gods)
- [6 Quest](#Quest)
- [7 Warrior rank titles](#Warrior_rank_titles)
- [8 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [9 Origin](#Origin)

## Starting equipment

- +1 [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword")
- +1 [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow")
- 25-50 blessed +0 [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt")
- 7-14 [carrots](/wiki/Carrot "Carrot")
- 7-14 [apples](/wiki/Apple "Apple")
- +0 [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield")
- +0 [scale mail](/wiki/Scale_mail "Scale mail")
- +0 pair of [low boots](/wiki/Low_boots "Low boots")

## Intrinsics

Warriors gain intrinsics at these [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

- XL 7: [Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")

## Techniques

Warriors start with the [weapon practice](/wiki/Weapon_practice "Weapon practice") and [shield block](/wiki/Shield_block "Shield block") [techniques](/wiki/Technique "Technique").

## Skills

| Warrior Skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| -------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max            | Skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Basic          | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [javelin](/wiki/Javelin "Javelin"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber")
- *Spellcasting*: [divination spells](/wiki/Divination_spells "Divination spells")                                                                                                                            |
| Skilled        | * *Weapons:* [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"), [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail"), [hammer](/wiki/Hammer "Hammer"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace")
* *Combat:* [two-weapon combat](/wiki/Two-weapon_combat "Two-weapon combat"), [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding") |
| Expert         | - *Weapons:* [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword"), [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword"), [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow")
- *Combat:* [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")                                     |

## Gods

- *Main article: [Religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion")*

The Warrior's pantheon is derived from Slavic folklore.

- Lawful: [Dazhbog](/index.php?title=Dazhbog\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dazhbog (page does not exist)")
- Neutral: [Yarovit-Yarilo](/index.php?title=Yarovit-Yarilo\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Yarovit-Yarilo (page does not exist)")
- Chaotic: [Svarozhits](/index.php?title=Svarozhits\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Svarozhits (page does not exist)")

## Quest

The [Warrior quest](/index.php?title=Warrior_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Warrior quest (page does not exist)") sees you fighting the [Archnemesis](/wiki/Archnemesis "Archnemesis") for [Sword of Svyatogor](/index.php?title=Sword_of_Svyatogor\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sword of Svyatogor (page does not exist)"). It is filled with [locusts](/wiki/Locust "Locust") and [Nymph (monster class)](/wiki/Nymph_\(monster_class\) "Nymph (monster class)"); randomly generated monsters are biased toward [red dragons](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon") and [barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"). The maps are similar to the [Knight quest](/wiki/Knight_quest "Knight quest").

## Warrior rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

- XL 1-2: Swords(wo)man
- XL 3-5: Longswords(wo)man
- XL 6-9: Two-Handed Swords(wo)man
- XL 10-13: Legionnaire
- XL 14-17: Crusader
- XL 18-21: Baron(ess)
- XL 22-25: Count(ess)
- XL 26-29: Duke/Duchess
- XL 30: Patriarch/Matriarch

## Strategy

The Warrior is a combat-oriented role whose high physical stats allow them to utilize a wide array of melee and ranged weapons. However, they lack any combat spellcasting skills, can only raise skill in [divination spells](/wiki/Divination_spells "Divination spells"), and beyond intrinsic speed they do not gain any intrinsics or techniques outside of those inherent to their race.

The Warrior's quest artifact is extremely hard to obtain, as Archnemesis is a difficult opponent that fights similarly to a stronger [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen").

Being a [drow](/wiki/Drow "Drow") can aid in the Warrior's melee fighting abilities, and a [vampire](/wiki/Vampire "Vampire") Warrior can deal extra damage by feeding on enemies.

## Origin

The Warrior is based on the [Gauntlet](/index.php?title=Gauntlet\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gauntlet (page does not exist)") role with the same name. If the Warrior is [weak](/wiki/Weak "Weak") from hunger, the game will display "Warrior needs food, badly!", which is a reference to Gauntlet's low health warning.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Warrior (role)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Warrior is a role that appears in SlashTHEM. They are a pure fighting-class derived from the Knight that starts with similar proficiency in riding, though they lack the Knight's jumping ability and less emphasis on offensive spellcasting and mounted combat - the polearms, lance and spellcasting skills outside of divination spells are restricted for Warriors.

Warriors must be lawful or neutral, and can be played as clockwork automata, dwarves, elves, giants, gnomes, hobbits, humans, or kobolds.

The Warrior's starting pet is a saddled pony. Just like the Knight, a Warrior's riding skill starts out Basic, allowing the player to pick up items while riding.

Contents

  • 1 Starting equipment
  • 2 Intrinsics
  • 3 Techniques
  • 4 Skills
  • 5 Gods
  • 6 Quest
  • 7 Warrior rank titles
  • 8 Strategy
  • 9 Origin

Starting equipment

  • +1 broadsword
  • +1 crossbow
  • 25-50 blessed +0 crossbow bolts
  • 7-14 carrots
  • 7-14 apples
  • +0 small shield
  • +0 scale mail
  • +0 pair of low boots

Intrinsics

Warriors gain intrinsics at these experience levels:

  • XL 7: Speed

Techniques

Warriors start with the weapon practice and shield block techniques.

Skills

Warrior Skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: dagger, javelin, club, saber
  • Spellcasting: divination spells
Skilled
  • Weapons: pick-axe, axe, scimitar, flail, hammer, spear, mace
  • Combat: two-weapon combat, riding
Expert
  • Weapons: short sword, broadsword, long sword, two-handed sword, crossbow
  • Combat: bare hands

Gods

Main article: Religion

The Warrior's pantheon is derived from Slavic folklore.

  • Lawful: Dazhbog
  • Neutral: Yarovit-Yarilo
  • Chaotic: Svarozhits

Quest

The Warrior quest sees you fighting the Archnemesis for Sword of Svyatogor. It is filled with locusts and Nymph (monster class); randomly generated monsters are biased toward red dragons and barbarians. The maps are similar to the Knight quest.

Warrior rank titles

The status line shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

  • XL 1-2: Swords(wo)man
  • XL 3-5: Longswords(wo)man
  • XL 6-9: Two-Handed Swords(wo)man
  • XL 10-13: Legionnaire
  • XL 14-17: Crusader
  • XL 18-21: Baron(ess)
  • XL 22-25: Count(ess)
  • XL 26-29: Duke/Duchess
  • XL 30: Patriarch/Matriarch

Strategy

The Warrior is a combat-oriented role whose high physical stats allow them to utilize a wide array of melee and ranged weapons. However, they lack any combat spellcasting skills, can only raise skill in divination spells, and beyond intrinsic speed they do not gain any intrinsics or techniques outside of those inherent to their race.

The Warrior's quest artifact is extremely hard to obtain, as Archnemesis is a difficult opponent that fights similarly to a stronger Master Kaen.

Being a drow can aid in the Warrior's melee fighting abilities, and a vampire Warrior can deal extra damage by feeding on enemies.

Origin

The Warrior is based on the Gauntlet role with the same name. If the Warrior is weak from hunger, the game will display "Warrior needs food, badly!", which is a reference to Gauntlet's low health warning.

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Warrior_(role)&oldid=165747"

rawPage:
The '''Warrior''' is a [[role]] that appears in [[SlashTHEM]]. They are a pure fighting-class derived from the [[Knight]] that starts with similar proficiency in [[riding]], though they lack the Knight's [[jumping]] ability and less emphasis on offensive spellcasting and mounted combat - the [[polearms]], [[lance]] and [[spellcasting]] skills outside of [[divination spell]]s are restricted for Warriors. 

Warriors must be lawful or neutral, and can be played as [[clockwork automata]], [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarves]], [[Elf (starting race)|elves]], [[Giant (starting race)|giants]], [[Gnome (starting race)|gnomes]], [[Hobbit (starting race)|hobbits]], [[Human (starting race)|humans]], or [[Kobold (starting race)|kobolds]].

The Warrior's starting pet is a [[saddle]]d [[pony]]. Just like the Knight, a Warrior's riding skill starts out Basic, allowing the player to pick up items while riding.

==Starting equipment==
* +1 [[broadsword]]
* +1 [[crossbow]]
* 25-50 blessed +0 [[crossbow bolt]]s
* 7-14 [[carrot]]s
* 7-14 [[apple]]s
* +0 [[small shield]]
* +0 [[scale mail]]
* +0 pair of [[low boots]]

==Intrinsics==
Warriors gain intrinsics at these [[experience level]]s:

* XL 7: [[Speed]]

==Techniques==
Warriors start with the [[weapon practice]] and [[shield block]] [[technique]]s.

== Skills ==

==Gods==
{{main|Religion}}

The Warrior's pantheon is derived from Slavic folklore.

* Lawful:  [[Dazhbog]]
* Neutral: [[Yarovit-Yarilo]]
* Chaotic: [[Svarozhits]]

==Quest==
The [[Warrior quest]] sees you fighting the [[Archnemesis]] for [[Sword of Svyatogor]]. It is filled with [[locust]]s and [[Nymph (monster class)]]; randomly generated monsters are biased toward [[red dragon]]s and [[barbarian]]s. The maps are similar to the [[Knight quest]].

==Warrior rank titles==
The [[status line]] shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified [[experience level]]:

*XL 1-2: Swords(wo)man
*XL 3-5: Longswords(wo)man
*XL 6-9: Two-Handed Swords(wo)man
*XL 10-13: Legionnaire
*XL 14-17: Crusader
*XL 18-21: Baron(ess)
*XL 22-25: Count(ess)
*XL 26-29: Duke/Duchess
*XL 30: Patriarch/Matriarch

==Strategy==
The Warrior is a combat-oriented role whose high physical stats allow them to utilize a wide array of melee and ranged weapons. However, they lack any combat spellcasting skills, can only raise skill in [[divination spells]], and beyond intrinsic speed they do not gain any intrinsics or techniques outside of those inherent to their race.

The Warrior's quest artifact is extremely hard to obtain, as Archnemesis is a difficult opponent that fights similarly to a stronger [[Master Kaen]].

Being a [[drow]] can aid in the Warrior's melee fighting abilities, and a [[vampire]] Warrior can deal extra damage by feeding on enemies.

==Origin==
The Warrior is based on the [[Gauntlet]] role with the same name. If the Warrior is [[weak]] from hunger, the game will display "Warrior needs food, badly!", which is a reference to Gauntlet's low health warning.
